analyzed: parivāra
translated: The chapter on miscellaneous rules

analyzed: bhikkhuni vibhaṅga
translated: The nuns’ rules and their analysis

analyzed: dutiya bhāga
translated: The second section🔽The permutation series on offenses

analyzed: pārājika kaṇḍa
translated: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

analyzed: kāyasasaggam sādiyana paccayā kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: How many kinds of offenses does one commit in relation to consenting to physical contact?

original: Kāyasaṁsaggaṁ sādiyanapaccayā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa adhakkhakaṁ ubbhajāṇumaṇḍalaṁ gahaṇaṁ sādiyati, āpatti pārājikassa;
analyzed: kāyasasaggam sādiyana paccayā pañca āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa adhakkhakam ubbhaja aṇu maṇḍalam gahaṇam sādiyati āpatti pārājikassa
translated: One commits five kinds of offenses:🔽if an lustful nun consents to a lustful man touching her below the collar bone but above the knees, she commits an offense entailing expulsion;

original: bhikkhu kāyena kāyaṁ āmasati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;🔽kāyena kāyapaṭibaddhaṁ āmasati, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: bhikkhu kāyena kāyam āmasati āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  kāyena kāya paṭibaddham āmasati āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: if a monk touches a body part to a body part, he commits an offense entailing suspension;🔽if he touches something connected to the body, he commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kāya paṭibaddhena kāya paṭibaddham āmasati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: if he touches a body part with something connected to the body, he commits an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: aṅguli patodake pācittiya
translated: and for every finger snap, he commits an offense entailing confession.

original: kāyasaṁsaggaṁ sādiyanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: kāya sasaggam sādiyana paccayā imāḥ pañca āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: One commits these five kinds of offenses in relation to consenting to physical contact.

analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādana paccayā kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: How many kinds of offenses does one commit in relation to concealing an offense?

analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādana paccayā catassaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: One commits four kinds of offenses:

original: Bhikkhunī jānaṁ pārājikaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicchādeti, āpatti pārājikassa;
analyzed: bhikkhunī jānam pārājikam dhammam paṭicchādeti āpatti pārājikassa
translated: If a nun conceals a nun’s offense of expulsion, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: vematikā paṭicchādeti, āpatti thullaccayassa;🔽bhikkhu saṅghādisesaṁ paṭicchādeti, āpatti pācittiyassa;
analyzed: vematikā paṭicchādeti āpatti thullaccayassa  bhikkhu saṅgha ādisesam paṭicchādeti āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: If she conceals it while unsure of it, she commits a serious offense.🔽If she conceals a monk’s offense entailing suspension, she commits an offense entailing confession.

analyzed: ācāra vipattim paṭicchādeti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: If she conceals a failure in conduct, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

analyzed: vajja ppaṭicchādana paccayā imāḥ catassaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: These are the four kinds of offenses one commits in relation to concealing an offense.

original: Yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: In relation to not stopping when pressed up to the third time, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

original: Yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā pañca āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: In relation to not stopping when pressed up to the third time, one commits five kinds of offenses:

original: Ukkhittānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: ukkhitta anuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati ñattiyā dukkaṭa
translated: If a nun who sides with one who has been ejected does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits an offense entailing confession for each announcement;

analyzed: dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: after two announcements, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti pārājikassa
translated: at the end of the third announcement, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: bhedakānuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
analyzed: bhedaka anuvattikā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: If a nun who sides with a schismatic does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyā yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati, āpatti pācittiyassa—
analyzed: pāpikāya diṭṭhiyāḥ yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjati āpatti pācittiyassa
translated: if she does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits an offense entailing confession.

original: yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā imā pañca āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā imāḥ pañca āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits five kinds of offenses:

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūraṇapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūraṇa paccayā kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she fulfills the eighth part, how many kinds of offenses does she commit?

original: Aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūraṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūraṇa paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she fulfills the eighth part, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: Purisena—“itthannāmaṁ okāsaṁ āgacchā”ti vuttā gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
analyzed: purisena etthannāmam okāsam āgacchāti vuttā gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she goes after being told, “Go to such-and-such a place,” she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

original: purisassa hatthapāsaṁ okkantamatte āpatti thullaccayassa;🔽aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūreti, āpatti pārājikassa—
analyzed: purisassa hattha pāsam okkanta matte āpatti thullaccayassa  aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūreti āpatti pārājikassa
translated: when she enters the man’s hand-to-hand range, she commits a serious offense;🔽when she fulfills the eighth part, she commits an offense entailing expulsion.

original: aṭṭhamaṁ vatthuṁ paripūraṇapaccayā imā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aṭṭhamam vatthum paripūraṇa paccayā imāḥ tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When she fulfills the eighth part, she commits these three kinds of offenses.

analyzed: pārājikā niṭṭhitā
translated: The offense entailing expulsion is finished.

analyzed: saṅgha ādi sesa kaṇḍa ādi
translated: The chapter on the most serious offenses, etc.

original: Ussayavādikā bhikkhunī aḍḍaṁ karaṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ussaya vādikā bhikkhunī aḍḍam karaṇa paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a nun who speaks for fun fulfills the conditions, she commits three kinds of offenses:

analyzed: ekassa āroceti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she tells one person, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: dutiyassa āroceti āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when he has informed the second, he commits a serious offense;

original: aḍḍapariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Coriṁ vuṭṭhāpanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: aḍḍa pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  corim vuṭṭhāpana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when the last word is spoken, he commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When giving the full admission to a criminal, there are three kinds of offenses:

analyzed: ñattiyā dukkaṭa
translated: when the motion is made, there is an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: when the first and second announcements are made, there is a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when the last announcement is made, there is an offense entailing suspension.

original: Ekā gāmantaraṁ gamanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: ekā gāmantaram gamana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When going to a second village on the same day, there are three kinds of offenses:

original: Gacchati, āpatti dukkaṭassa;🔽paṭhamaṁ pādaṁ parikkhepaṁ atikkāmeti, āpatti thullaccayassa;
analyzed: gacchati āpatti dukkaṭassa  paṭhamam pādam parikkhepam atikkāmeti āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: when she is going, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;🔽when she crosses the boundary of the first village, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: dutiyam pādam atikkāmeti āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when she crosses the boundary of the second village, she commits an offense entailing suspension.🔽When reinstating a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule, the rule’s basis, the rule’s addition, and the account, without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure, there are three kinds of offenses:

original: Samaggena saṅghena ukkhittaṁ bhikkhuniṁ dhammena vinayena satthusāsanena anapaloketvā kārakasaṅghaṁ anaññāya gaṇassa chandaṁ osāraṇapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ;
analyzed: samaggena saṅghena ukkhittam bhikkhunim dhammena vinayena satthu sāsanena an apaloketvā kāraka saṅgham an aññāya gaṇassa chandam osāraṇa paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ñattiyā dukkaṭa
translated: when the motion is made, there is an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: when the first and second announcements are made, there is a serious offense;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when the last announcement is made, there is an offense entailing suspension.

original: Avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisapuggalassa hatthato khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: avassutā bhikkhunī avassutassa purisa puggalassa hatthato khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā sahatthā paṭiggahetvā bhuñjana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When a lustful nun receives fresh or cooked food directly from an unrelated male householder who is lustful, she commits three kinds of offenses:

original: “Khādissāmi bhuñjissāmī”ti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti thullaccayassa;🔽ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti saṅghādisesassa;
analyzed: khādissāmi bhuñjissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti thullaccayassa  ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits a serious offense;🔽for every mouthful, she commits an offense entailing suspension;

analyzed: udaka danta ponam paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when she receives water or tooth cleaners, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.

original: “Kiṁ te, ayye, eso purisapuggalo karissati avassuto vā anavassuto vā, yato tvaṁ anavassutā.
analyzed: kim te ayye esaḥ purisa puggalo karissati avassutaḥ vā an avassutaḥ vā yatas tvam an avassutā
translated: “Venerable, what can this man do to you, whether he’s lustful or not, when you’re not lustful?

original: Iṅgha, ayye, yaṁ te eso purisapuggalo deti khādanīyaṁ vā bhojanīyaṁ vā taṁ tvaṁ sahatthā🔽paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā”ti, uyyojanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: iṅgha ayye yam te esaḥ purisa puggalaḥ deti khādanīyam vā bhojanīyam vā tam tvam sahatthā  paṭiggahetvā khāda vā bhuñja vā ti uyyojana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: Come, Venerable, receive with your own hands

original: Tassā vacanena khādissāmi bhuñjissāmīti paṭiggaṇhāti, āpatti dukkaṭassa;
analyzed: tassāḥ vacanena khādissāmi bhuñjissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: the fresh or cooked food that he gives you, and then eat it or consume it.” When she receives it with the intention of eating it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti thullaccayassa
translated: for every mouthful, she commits a serious offense;

analyzed: bhojana pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: When the meal is finished, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

original: Kupitā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ;🔽dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā;
analyzed: kupitā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: When a nun who is angry does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:🔽when the motion is made, an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when two statements of the motion have been made, a serious offense;🔽when the third statement of the motion has been made, an offense entailing suspension.

original: Kismiñcideva adhikaraṇe paccākatā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ;🔽dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā;
analyzed: kismiṃcid eva adhikaraṇe paccākatā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: When a nun who has been pressed does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:🔽when the motion is made, an offense of wrong conduct;

original: kammavācāpariyosāne āpatti saṅghādisesassa.🔽Saṁsaṭṭhā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa  sa saṭṭhā bhikkhunī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: when two statements of the motion have been made, a serious offense;🔽when the third statement of the motion has been made, an offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: When a nun who is socializing does not stop when pressed up to the third time, she commits three kinds of offenses:🔽when the motion is made, an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when two statements of the motion have been made, a serious offense;🔽when the third statement of the motion has been made, an offense entailing suspension.

original: “Saṁsaṭṭhāva, ayye, tumhe viharatha, mā tumhe nānā viharitthā”ti uyyojentī yāvatatiyaṁ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā tisso āpattiyo āpajjati.🔽Ñattiyā dukkaṭaṁ;🔽dvīhi kammavācāhi thullaccayā;
analyzed: ayye tumhe viharatha mā tumhe nānā viharittha ati uyyojentī yāvatatiyam samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjana paccayā tissaḥ āpattiyaḥ āpajjati  ñattiyā dukkaṭa  dvīhi kamma vācāhi thullaccayā
translated: “Venerables, live together, don’t live separately,” she commits three kinds of offenses:

analyzed: kamma vācā pariyosāne āpatti saṅgha ādisesassa
translated: when she has been directed by a group, then for not stopping, she commits an offense entailing confession when she has been directed for the second time;🔽when she has been directed for the third time, she commits an offense entailing suspension.

analyzed: dasa saṅgha ādisesā niṭṭhitā pe
translated: The ten rules entailing suspension are finished. …

analyzed: yathā heṭṭhā tathā vitthāretabbā paccayam eva
translated: (The same as above, but with “three” instead of “two” and “four” instead of “two” and “three”.)

original: Dadhiṁ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā kati āpattiyo āpajjati?
analyzed: dadhim viññāpetvā bhuñjana paccayā kati āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When asking for curd and then eating it, how many kinds of offenses does one commit?

original: Dadhiṁ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: dadhim viññāpetvā bhuñjana paccayā dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When asking for curd and then eating it, one commits two kinds of offenses:

analyzed: bhuñjissāmi iti paṭiggaṇhāti āpatti dukkaṭassa
translated: when one accepts it with the intention of eating it, one commits an offense of wrong conduct;

analyzed: ajjhohāre ajjhohāre āpatti pāṭidesanīyassa
translated: for every mouthful, one commits an offense entailing acknowledgment.

original: dadhiṁ viññāpetvā bhuñjanapaccayā imā dve āpattiyo āpajjati.
analyzed: dadhim viññāpetvā bhuñjana paccayā imā dve āpattiyaḥ āpajjati
translated: When asking for curd and then eating it, one commits these two kinds of offenses.

analyzed: kata āpatti vāraḥ niṭṭhitaḥ dutiyaḥ
translated: The second section on the kinds of offenses is finished.
